Droppable (type in module ui.drop )

Description

Droppable state is an object containing the droppable state of a particular DOM node. It is instantiated and attached via droppable().

The Droppable object is attached to a DOM node via jqLite / jQuery's expandostore, using the key $droppable. However, it is recomended that querying for a node's Droppable state be done using droppable() or isDroppable(), in case the expandostore key is changed in the future.

This object provides helpers, including a mechanism to programmatically drop an arbitrary Draggable onto the current Droppable. This mechanic is used by $drop.drop() in order to complete the work.

Usage

Droppable();

Returns

{Object} –

Newly created Droppable instance.

Methods

  • allowedSelectors(An)

    A Setter/Getter method for the array of allowed selectors for this droppable.

    Parameters

    • An – {allowedSelectors} –

      array of strings representing selectors of draggables which can be dropped within the draggable

    Returns

    {Array} –

    Array of strings

  • drop(draggable, options)

    Simplifies the process of dropping a dragged element over a $droppable element, and appending it to the $droppable node's children.

    Parameters

    • draggable(optional) – {Draggable=} –

      The Draggable state of the dragged element, or the current dragging object by default.

    • options(optional) – {options=} –

      Presently this parameter is essentially unused. It is intended to enable some customized behaviour in the future.
